dialog: <font color"ffff00">Provided by explosiveskull</font> https://twitter.com/kaboomskull M_I_SForEver What the fuck?
You want me to make you breakfast?
Why you looking at me like that?
You didn't sleep again last night.
You want to tell me about it?
I don't know, you were mumbling something.
I really can't remember, to be honest.
Why do you keep shutting me out?
Uh, don't lay that all on me.
You got your own life, too.
It means like everyone's got their own responsibilities.
So why are you so worried about mine?
You know, I only stayed in Ithaca to summer because I thought we were going to have something special.
So why is everything so difficult with you?
You know, sometimes I feel like, it's like, you want me to disappoint you.
I don't know where your brother is at.
Fuck you mean, you don't know my brother is at?
I don't know where your brother is at.
You know where he's at when you want to get high, though, right?
Ain't no chill, mind your business.
Do me a favor, yo, stop touching me.
Keep touching me, you making me mad hot.
I'm fucking him up and have my sister fuck you up.
Yeah, I will fuck you up.
Get the fuck up outta here, you bitch as nigga.
You ain't gonna shit to nobody  Fuck you, ain't nobody even talking to you.
Shut up, that's why you walking off, you bitch ass nigga.
He ain't gonna do nothing to nobody.
Is that what this is about?
Bet you were waiting to say that, huh?
Okay, well you're freaking me out right now.
What, don't look at me like that.
So, you're gonna call me or?
You got to be fucking joking.
I don't know what to tell you, honey.
He ain't said anything about coming by here.
Now, you know how he is.
Why didn't you message me and let me know he came by the house?
It's going to take him awhile to adjust.
That has nothing to do with me.
I can care less about any of that.
Get the fuck out of here.
Look who the fuck just fell off the back of a milk carton and shit.
I heard them white folks got you downtown.
Nah man, it ain't even like that.
Man, I'm out here doing my community service, though, man.
You always got some funny shit to say, though.
You know, them two for fives, they gonna go, man.
You know what I mean, but what's up, though?
What the fuck you been doing?
You seen my brother up here, man?
He might be up there with that broad and shit, man.
What the hell you knocking on my door like, for?
What you mean, it's too late, yo.
Watch out man, I'mma talk to his ass.
You know why the fuck I'm here, man.
Yeah, let me a bogey, Luc.
I ain't got no bogey for you.
Why the fuck did you take my laptop?
Man, I ain't take a goddamn thing.
Yo, I know you was there, man.
I know you was at mommy's house.
The fuck you do that for, man?
And as for you, you better find my shit 'cause you best believe, I'm coming back.
I don't know what's going on between you two.
It ain't got nothing to do with me.
I need to ask for an extension on the final.
There's a lot of family stuff going on and uh...
I know going back to school hasn't been easy for you.
But if you're going to turn this assignment in late, again, I'm going to need a note.
Yeah, like a note from a doctor.
Look, I want you to know something.
That last assignment you turned in, was brilliant.
Yeah, it was the best in the class.
You give me that note, I'll give you two days.
But I believe you can do it.
It's a contact at the student health services.
Maybe he can help you get that note.
The library is closing in five minutes, five minutes.
You just said five minutes, one minute ago.
Do you need help with anything?
No, I don't need any help.
Yeah, there's some on my pants.
I'm gonna get us some more napkins.
I'll just lick it, that's okay.
No, I don't think she wants any.
I think I'm gonna say yes.
You're going to say yes to her getting some?
Chocolate chip, chocolate chip ice cream?
Oh my gosh, you're such a lucky girl.
She was good for me today.
You wanna watch Goldie and the Bears?
You're gonna watch Goldie and the Bear in your room.
Lucas, I thought we agreed, no sugar?
Lazifa, I only gave her a little, it's not gonna kill her.
Still, you're creating bad eating habits for her.
You still talking to that girl?
Nah, I haven't talked to her in a minute.
Ah, you know, I don't like being reminded how old I am.
I thought she was coming with us.
She wanted to go to the circus with Lazifa.
Lazifa texted me this morning, wishing me happy birthday.
I thought that was kind of sweet.
You know, Lazifa should come by a little more often.
I can't remember when the last time I saw her.
You know, it's one minute, we're up.
That doesn't have a damn thing to do with me.
I really like her, a lot.
Why you always coming to the sales department?
You ain't gonna find nothing over here.
I'm going to go check out these laptops.
Don't leave me here too long, Lucas.
Did you get a chance to talk to Kenji?
Same old shit with that dude.
What's that supposed to mean, ma?
Did you ever stop to think about how he feels?
You know, what he's going through?
Ma, we've been here plenty of times.
There's no such thing as helping anybody too much.
You know, maybe that's the problem.
Maybe we're helping 'em too much, you know?
Are you insinuating that I'm an enabler?
Ah, I didn't say all that.
Yeah, you're insinuating that I'm an enabler.
Thank you for the day, Lucas.
You should try to eat some of that broccoli, though.
You should try some of the carrots.
Here, you can write on this one.
Hey, can you write your name?
Hello, you've received TC3's counseling and psychological services.
My name is Ben, how can I help you?
Uh yeah, I'm a student at TC3.
Uh, I'mma have to call you back.
I just left your bags in the closet.
I thought you wanted to talk about?
What do you mean, you don't know?
Yeah, I want you to take your things.
As if I love you, like, what about Zanura, she needs me, too.
Like, if it's about Mariah, like, I'm not talking to her anymore, I promise.
Look, I don't think you should sleep over anymore.
And if you need to see Zanura, you can come by tomorrow.
Have you ever talked to anyone like me before?
No, I can't say I have.
I'm kind of being forced to come here.
It's say here on your application that you're having problems studying.
Yeah, it's kind kinda my thing.
Hmm, so distractions at home or, elsewhere?
I mean, that's part of it.
It's my brother  Your brother's distracting you?
He's 11 years older than me, still acting the same damn way we did as kids.
And what is it about your brother that's nagging you and preventing you from being productive?
It's like, first it was my winter jacket.
He took my daughter's piggy bank, sold that.
Is he stealing from the rest of your family?
Just me, thinks I have a whole bunch of money or something.
Have you set boundaries with him?
It's like you tell him to do one thing and he does the complete opposite.
And my mom, she doesn't choose sides, but, I think she knows I'm right.
Lucas, what do you really want right now?
I just don't want to go back to my old ways.
Drinking, fucking, wanting to fight people for talking shit.
Now, I just want my daughter to go to a good college.
Shit, I even want Lazifa to be happy.
It's all good things to want.
You wanna talk a little bit more about that?
Is it going to get me a doctor's note?
Because right now, I don't have too much time.
I got to get going, soon.
Lucas, do you think that you could tell your brother that you love him, but you know, you can't really hang if he's going to act out inappropriately?
To be honest with you, man, the next time I see that nigga, I'm going to kill him.
Chapter five and chapter four are what you generally, ideas that you brought in the reflection page, I think.
Which was it, chapter five and chapter 10?
So it's like a reference to a similar issue that you were trying to address.
And one thing that I would like to talk to you, is about your reflection that you send me.
For me, it's not clear what you're trying to say...
So what is this, like some weird mating ritual you do?
So you don't answer my texts, but you feel compelled to just pop up out of nowhere?
Fuck, are you going to get a drink?
Yeah well, apple juice doesn't count.
And don't rub it on your clothes.
Just rub it on your hands, all right.
We're all gonna smell good, oh, oh.
How do you smell, how you smelling, you smelling good?
You gotta rub the backs, too, rub the backs.
Gotta get in between your fingers, too.
Gotta put on some perfume, here.
On your clothes, yeah, it's good.
Are you going to eat me?
Well, not right, I think I'd rather eat this spaghetti.
Yeah, I'm gonna rub that on just a little bit.
Turn around here, let me see.
Zanura, aren't you too young for lipstick?
You're not suppose to lick it off.
What do you want to drink, Darlene?
I'll have a glass of ice water if you don't mind.
Let me see, let me fix it.
I like it, I like it, I like it.
So, how long have you been cooking?
I'm glad you invited me to dinner.
Zanura was looking forward to having this pasta with you.
Mommy, thank you for the spaghetti.
I know Lucas can be difficult sometimes, Lazifa.
But I'd like it, if you two could work things out.
Do I hold a stick and try to hit balls on the table?
There's a lot you don't know about me.
There's a lot I don't tell you because I didn't want to scare you off.
It would be weird if you didn't.
I feel like you hide stuff from me because you think I don't understand or resent me for not having the same upbringing as you.
I'd trade places with you in the past, present and future.
My father was murdered when I was six years old.
I never got to say goodbye to anybody.
Fuck, I hate talking about this shit.
You know, when he died, it was just like I was expecting Kenji to fill his shoes.
Well, I bet he'd be proud of you now.
Reminds me of all the stuff I had to learn my own.
Shit other kids took for granted.
I can't keep doing this with you, Luc.
But you can't just say one thing and then expect everything between us to suddenly change.
Like , why are we even trying to be something?
I'm not normally around people like you.
I mean, don't get me wrong.
I mean, everything I'm telling you is the truth.
I'm not here to just hold your hand, when you're feeling down.
You need to figure your shit out.
So why is that one your mom and this one is me?
Because, I made it for me.
I got one in my ear.
Um, look at what I have.
Are you playing a game with grandma?
We can play a real game later.
I wanna go, have, go, mama.
Yeah, I was already in the area.
Nah, I all right, thanks, though.
You know, it wouldn't hurt for you to come to dinner, next time.
Just don't think it would be a good idea.
You know, I see things in you that others don't see.
They just don't know you the way I do.
Is there something I can help ya out with?
Your call has been forward to an automated system.
I think you should keep those.
Are you really going to go to Seattle?
I don't think you should go, though.
I know me coming here like this, is weird.
Do you still love your baby's mother?
Look, I love her, but I'm not in love with her.
I want to be with you.
Look, I got it, I got it!
Look Mariah, like, I've messed up.
What do you, what do you want me to say?
Like, I don't want you to go to Seattle.
What are you even going to do there?
I'm not even going to do that.
I don't want to miss my flight.
What the fuck is it with you, man?
You know, shit just get crazy sometimes.
But yo, I'm looking for it.
I mean, you're going to do what you're going to do anyways, right?
I'm going to call your phone, as sure as I get it.
Don't jump on mommy's and daddy's bed.
You jump on your own bed.
Sister, take this in the bathroom.
Okay, I'll take it in the bathroom.
Okay, is this the bathroom up here, right?
Yeah, you  No, I don't, I don't.
I'm ready to go out there.
You guys wanna get something to eat?
No, no, no, no, no, again.
You wanna say bye, to daddy?
No, I wanna still  Say bye to daddy.
If you need me to watch her this week, I can take some time off.
